title: Weekly reminder that the tank update left some champions too weak.
body:
Poppy, mundo, naut and malphite are still rocking below 50% winrates an some deeper below 46%. 
These champs built sunfire when it was good, and now don't even build it anymore. 
Can we see some buffs soon?
http://na.op.gg/champion/statistics

replies.body:
Only somewhat related, but does anyone have any good ideas for an interesting version of Sunfire Cape that you'd be excited to use and play against? We've been slow to buff Sunfire because the gameplay it brings when it's good isn't very interesting or fun, and so it's at best overly niche right now.

That said, leaving it pretty bleh isn't the right treatment, and we would like to do something with it to make it worth its spot in the shop. So if you have any ideas, I'd be interested in hearing them. Buffing its stats or the damage of its current effect probably wouldn't cut it.

1. Give tanks another solid core armor item with less generic offensive capabilities so Sunfire can be made stronger and more niche.

2. Make it billow behind tanks like an actual cape, and make the damage ramp up over time on any given target. This gives it more interactive gameplay and makes it stronger defensively (as you run away) but weaker aggressively unless you get ahead of them. I'm thinking a shorter singed trail type thing shaped like a cone with the narrowest end at the wearer.

Have the constant AOE effect become minions only.

Then whenever the character casts an ability a wave of fire bursts forth from the champion dealing magic damage to surrounding enemy champions. Put it on a two second cooldown. This way it allows the champion damage portion of the item to become stronger and more impactful without hurting it's ability to help tanks farm and/or push.
This is probably the best way to keep it's niche as tank waveclear while making it more interesting to play with and against.

Repertoir, you should ask yourself what's the point of sunfire cape and who is the primary user?  I asked about this recently and I was told that it is a bad item for tanks who what waveclear, they like titanic hydra now, it's not that cost effective anymore, and the range is terrible.

So I think before we can answer this, it'd help us out a lot of we had a focus or goal of some kind.  I mean I could pull _chainmail + giant's belt + sheen_ = stats plus your next AA shreds 20% of the target's AR/MR... but that's probably not going to cut it, right?

Here's another important question: do you want this to be an aura item or not?  Riot hates auras so it seems like removing the aura is step one.

 
* {{item:3105}}+{{item:3113}} = tankiness+ap+mobility for AP tanks and AP bruisers
* {{item:3076}}+{{item:1011}} = more HP, less AR version of thornmail
* Delete {{item:1401}}{{item:1409}}{{item:1413}} and make {{item:3068}} a jungler's item
* Have the passive deal damage to towers
* Have the damage scale on your bonus HP instead of level, yes this is a damage buff, but encourages building HP and interaction with titanic hydra.
* Give it a move speed active for a hard engage
* You get a passive movespeed bonus based on the amount of damage you've taken in the last 7 seconds
* Have the AoE damage and range scale off of damage taken in the last 3 seconds
* {{item:1043}}+{{item:1031}}+{{item:1011}} = your AA do magic damage that scale off of your max HP.  Basically an item for champs like shyvana, irelia, or Vi.

Hey, just wanted to say it's really awesome when you guys ask us questions like this. The community is full of ideas and it feels great to see you listening to them.

More of this please!

I play a lot of Top lane.
The only reason I do not buy {{item:3751}} (and by extension therefore do not buy {{item:3068}} ) is because Bami's Cinder is a health item instead of an armor item.

What do all the struggling champions listed in the OP have in common (Poppy, Mundo, Malphite, and Nautilus)?  They all rely on a shielding or an extreme health regen mechanic to sustain lane.  Both of these mechanics scale off of their resists.

Minion aggro and trading are also resist dependent, making {{item:3076}} a much more efficient item in lane than Bami's Cinder.

Even if you increased Bramble Vest's price to 1200 or even 1500 gold, I would still buy it over Bami's Cinder for waveclear and laning due to the armor it gives.
--------------------------
Taking what I wrote above into account, I believe it would be worthwhile to investigate a buildpath for Bami's Cinder and its associated items to be more armor-oriented.

As for Enchantment: Cinderhulk, it's strange that this is purely a health item to begin with.
It's meant to be a Sunfire Cape for junglers; to be built primarily on tanks, which happen to scale off of resists.  It may be worth investigating a nerf to the flat hp, adding some armor to the item, then slightly adjusting its health scaling.

Thank you for your time and consideration of my suggestion.

You're not playing top lane tanks correctly if you don't rush HP early. Bonus HP in the early levels gives you way more survivability than resistances. 

{{item:3751}} isn't a good rush item ever since the HP nerf down to 200. So what I do is rush double {{item:1028}} or {{item:1011}} instead on Poppy. On the second or third back, I'll upgrade to {{item:3751}}

I guess the first question is actually: what's the goal of the item? If it was more interactive, could it really be a "damage" item for Tanks? Or is that totally out of the realm of possibilities?

I seem to remember you gave ramping damage to Cinderhulk but then it was removed. Why? Isn't that a good solution for Sunfire?

(EDIT'ed to remove some useless blabbering.)

I've thought about this for a bit, frankly. I feel part of it is that you CAN'T have consistent uptime, and/or you need to reward people for sticking to their targets with it, rather than just having it always churning at the same rate.

Some thoughts. Note that some of these reposition it in more of a burst-oriented role, and some as more of a control-tank role.

***Unique Passive: [Immolate]*** Surround enemies take 2-5 damage per second (based on level). Every X attack fires a short, wide cone of flame that deals X magic damage (maybe % health based) to targets caught in its path.

***Unique Passive [Sunfire's Brilliance]:*** Nearby enemies gain stacks of Sunfire every 1 second. Upon reaching X stacks they take Y magic damage and are blinded for 1.5 seconds. X second cooldown per target before stacks are reapplied.

***Unique Passive [Sunfire's Brilliance]:*** Nearby enemies gain stacks of Sunfire every X seconds. Activate to deal X magic damage to targets and blind them for Y seconds, both based on the number of stacks accumulated. X second activation cooldown (rather short).

***Unique Passive [Immolate]:*** Every 3 seconds you give off a pulse of sunfire, damaging nearby targets and applying a stack of Sunfire. Enemies take additional damage for every stack of Sunfire on them.

***Unique Passive [Sunfire Burst]:*** Fire off a line of flame in six-eight directions around a sphere, dealing magic damage to targets it hits. After 1.5 seconds the flames reconverge on your current position, dealing magic damage again.
Make it a Toggle/active for x duration effect that burns the user as well as enemy minions and champions.
you buffed Mundo's ult to get him back in the game. But did you ever think about it was a to Op buff?

What if it had a charge like Sightstone? For example, imagine you had say 60 seconds of fire. You can toggle it, and it ticks once a second for a set amount of damage. Once that 60 seconds is used up, it's just armor and HP, and can't be turned on until you recall. That way you have to manage it carefully so you don't blow it all on say just trading like a fool. It would have clear uses on champs with lower lane sustain since they back more often, and champs with high sustain can't use it as well like say Garen or Maokai. This would reduce its abuse by high sustain champs so that they can't just get it and permenantly add to their damage output while also having that built in sustain. I think you could then also buff it's damage or range with numbers tweaks, like giving it only 30 seconds of up time for more power or something. Or maybe even two variants, one with bonus damage to minions that lasts longer and one that's just a shirt ten second active that gives timed bursts of AOE? I'm just tossing shit out.

One of my biggest problems is the extremely short range starting from hirbox center rather then edge which means if your champ is big like sion or cho you hit them with basic attacks before you can so much as scare them with your aura range

Looking back on my original concept one could fix the aura so it's better on bigger champions, like tanks, instead of it being worse

Then up the combustion effect by letting it keep the 50% bigger radius and making it deal like 10x damage after you get hit 10 times it could even have a health ratio or add a debuff etc etc whatever it takes to prevent abuse although requiring the taking of attacks already sort of does this

ofc the effect/damage would have to be tuned so it's not oppressive early nor weak in later teamfights as it would now have appropriate counterplay

Decrease the damage to one enemy champion, but increase it as the number of enemy champions around increases (make it have optimal dmg at 2-3 champions). In my opinion, Sunfire Cape has 2 purposes: help with farming, and serve as a damage output in teamfights, and I don't think the item does the latter very well. The item should reward tanks going in the middle of a fight to disrupt the entire enemy team, and soaking up all the damage directed to their team. Maybe its stats should be nerfed to compensate for this, to make Sunfire Cape a more "battle-oriented" tank item.

It could perhaps be a more specialized item. The fire aura could be a short window active, think of it like a tank version of the Hydra items. Either make it more damagey, or it could use the new CC, Brittle.

Why not try to not make it a flashy mess of an item.  Not everything needs to be eye catching, that's like saying the ADC items are interactive and fun. This design philosophy is really confusing and seems to be a hamper on actual logical balance in your headquarters.  I suggest you abandon it.

General theme seems to be "make waves of fire situational, visible and impactful". Rewarding a certain action or trigger with a billowing circle of flame that has a noticeable effect on nearby enemies would be satisfying, and shift it from being "you take trace amounts of damage when you stand near me" to "you don't want to stand near me when I do (this thing)".

This effect could be straight damage or a brief DoT, and possibly have bonus effects such as empowering the Sunfire-user's power against affected targets for a short duration.

just a couple ideas on top of my head.

how about the burn dmg ramping up over time?

e.g first sec burn is 8 dmg, 2nd second burn is 10 dmg, 3 sec is 12 dmg, up to a max of like 8 secs or something.

numbers can be tweaked, making this burn the minions slower and making them a super threat if a team fight last too long. If they fail to stick on an enemy, the dmg ramp resets.

What if Sunfire cape (and perhaps Cinder Hulk too) did extremely low AoE damage to minions (the damage to monsters is essential for how Cinderhulk clears the jungle). Maybe even no passive damage to champions at all.

Then it got an active that you could cast on something like the cool down of Hydra (so 10-20 seconds), where after 2 seconds it pulsed out a wave of damage in a medium sized aoe. Gates the damage to champions behind a timer, and means you need to be able to predict when you can exist inside the minions with a proper reward.

Considering how Sunfire Cape is a damage + tankiness item, I feel it might be more appropriate on fighters than on actual tanks, who I think should instead have their own CC/utility valued instead on their own items. I also feel the main issue right now with Sunfire is with its passive, which doesn't convey its damage in the most interesting manner. Here's how I'd go about changing the item:
---
#Sunfire Cape
* **Recipe:** Bami's Cinder + Jaurim's Fist + 800g (total cost: 2900g).
* **Stats:** +500 health, +30 attack damage (+0 health and +15 attack damage from its components).
* **Unique Passive - Immolate:** Moving and attacking makes the next basic attack _Energized_. Energized attacks grant the wielder 15 - 100 armor for 4 seconds, and at the end of the duration the wielder deals 45 - 300 magic damage to all nearby enemies.

The numbers and specifics are obviously placeholder, but the idea is that instead of simply dealing small amounts of PBAoE damage per tick, the wielder would build up to a powerful burst of damage over time. Because this would require the wielder to stick to the target for an extended duration as well, it would also encourage fighters to commit or initiate, rather than just inch out trade advantages in lane. What are your thoughts on this?

Make it periodically shoot a gout of flame in one of the four directions (left, right, up down).  Use Fiora passive indicator to warn both players of where the flames are going to shoot next.   This way tank can clear waves by positioning themselves within the wave while giving the opponent a chance to dodge the flames as long as the AoE effect starts on the edge of the model.

Now you can tune a) period b) range c) damage instead of just a) damage you can tune on the current version.

What's the identity of the item? If I understand correctly, its identity is torn between:
- waveclear item (and here again: is it for champs that already have good wc to double down on it, or for champs that lack wc to give them some?)
- teamfight damage (since aoe)
- dueling damage (this was actually moved away from since the damage was changed to be mostly on minions, but it's still worth mentioning)

The first thing that I can think of (and it's probably not a very bright idea, but still) is to use it to amp existing waveclear: when hitting minions with a spell, burn them for X damage. This would favor champs with aoe, low CD spells, and amp their waveclear/pushing power.
I don't think Sunfire Cape is an item that should be taken for fighting champions (though I admit I do), especially because it's so uninteractive.

> The first thing that I can think of (and it's probably not a very bright idea, but still) is to use it to amp existing waveclear: when hitting minions with a spell, burn them for X damage. This would favor champs with aoe, low CD spells, and amp their waveclear/pushing power.

The main problem with this is at that point you might as well buy {{item:3025}} {{item:3077}} {{item:3748}} which also give wave clear but is much more useful in combat with enemy champions or you could even buy something like {{item:3001}} since if the champion already have wave clear then just getting more mana to use that wave clear also work just fine

This makes a lot of sense actually, thank you :) (i'm not a top lane player, and I'm low elo even though i've been playing for years, so my insight here is limited)
So, IBG and Hydra are both items that amp up waveclear but are a lot more specific for different kind of champs (spell users for IBG, autoattackers for tiamat/hydra).
So this makes the question be again: what is the niche sunfire cape wants to/should fill? What is it for? I don't tnink it should be for waveclear, nor for dueling. Does this mean there's no need for sunfire in LoL?

The appropriate action to take is to make changes to Poppy, Mundo, Sion, Nautilus and Malphite to encourage them to jungle and move them out of top lane completely. 

No change that you make is going to let Sunfire compete against The Black Cleaver, nor should it. The entire point of the tank update was to make single purchase tank items less effective and useful. And in exchange, Cinderhulk has been buffed, praise be.

As much as it sucks, if this is your balance philosophy now then stick with it. Make changes to push these champions out of top lane and into the jungle where they are much healthier.

AoE damage to minions and monsters lowered. Damage to champions ramps up the more time you manage to stick to them but starts falling when they aren't in range. After some "stacks are earned the damage and Area of effect of sunfire is increased noticeably until you exit combat

Make the fire damage a single line, and rotate around the player, similarly to Aureleon Sol. Probably not a great idea, but it would allow the damage to be higher (for that sweet waveclear) while allowing more counterplay options for the enemy.

Maybe every 5 seconds it provides a burst of fire damage that does bonus damage to minions/monsters.

Maaaybe have it only activate when you take damage. (But then it gets close to thornmail in design).

Hell, maybe just make it an active: For 10 seconds deal bonus magic damage to nearby enemies, double to minions/monsters... but then it conflicts with the active of the smite items........

Honestly, just making it burst out every 2.5 seconds might work the best. It allows a bit of counterplay while still being useful. And a set damage time would make farming a bit easier too.

I'd like to see what it would look like to strip off the flame aura and make it a bit more flashy.  Maybe it could pulse a wave of fire when you activate the item?  Would love to see the cape pulse damage every time you get hit by an auto attack or maybe build up stacks and then burst like a nova after being hit a few times.

Sunfire cape is more interesting to deal with than Bramble Vest.

That's not even hyperbole. Sunfire cape's damage always being on means that counterplay has a clear 'fail' case of standing nearby while not doing anything (cc'd or abilities on cooldown) that it can be balanced around for success with a middling ground of "if you are in range, make sure you're dealing damage" while thorns only works if you are attacking the champion meaning it has to be balanced to be absurdly strong if someone is trying to interact with the tank. In lane when you only have one potential target, that is absurd.

Some have suggested make it like Leona W which sounds pretty cool. 

Why not have it so the effect of sunfire is after x seconds (im going with three for a decent number) of being in the sunfire radius the enemies are marked for 5s. Attacking a marked enemy deals X Damage to them. (10s - 3s CD before applying another mark) (note it will not have the passive burn effect) Optional have the item also have an active which can reset the effect CD once or causes the Aoe Burn for X seconds (3~5 would be good)

This still allows it to be used for wave clear but also makes it have some downtime in the way it functions and still be slightly offensive in nature.

okay, so I've got a few ideas. first thing that comes to mind, and has already been mentioned by others, is a toggle/active effect. This will def allow for better fine tuning of the cape's power level, and power spikes, but I feel that atm, league hast _too many_ active effect items as is.

So instead, how about something different? I noticed that ya'll were toying around with the concept to reactive effects with masteries/runes (i.e. after taking damage do 'x') so why not try that out?

For example, have Sunfire have a passive aura that pulses once ever 'x' seconds (let's say 3 for now) since the pulse is so long, you could even give a small vfx to indicate when the next pulse will be, that way the pulse can do modest damage. It will reduce it's effectiveness for wave clearing while not removing that feature entirely (cuz let's face it, that's one of the key benefits of sunfire)

now for the reactive effect: every time you receive damage from an enemy champion, the cape "flares up" and begins pulsing once every half second for 2 seconds, then over the next 3 seconds slows down to it's original rate. (you can fine tune these numbers as needed, and even throw in a lock out mechanic if necessary to prevent it from overly punishing opponents that try to all in) (also, you could throw in large jungle monsters also proc'ing this effect so that junglers won't feel bad about getting it)

IMO this allows Sunfire to become a relevant item again, as atm, the aoe pulse just doesn't feel meaningful as an anti-engage tool, and the stats currently are kinda lack luster as well.
